pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:5.1: 41. The training rule on royal houses
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:6.2: At that time a picture had been drawn in the decorated pleasure-house in King Pasenadi of Kosala’s park.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:6.3: Many people went to see the pleasure-house,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:6.4: and so did the nuns from the group of six.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:6.6: “How can nuns go to see the pleasure-house? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six go to see a pleasure-house?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.7: How can the nuns from the group of six go to see a pleasure-house?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:8.1: ‘If a nun goes to see a royal house or a pleasure-house or a park or a garden or a lotus pond, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:15.1: If she is on her way to see them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:15.2: Wherever she stands to see them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:15.3: Every time she moves outside the range of sight and then sees them again, she commits an offense entailing confession.
